Facility Supervisor Job at SpringRock Group




        
    

        
        SpringRock Group is a privately held energy company with main focus in Oil and Gas and Power sectors of the energy domain. We straddle both aisles of the Oil and Gas industry as E&P Operator and Oilfield Service provider.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Facility Supervisor

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Summary
     

            
    




	We are seeking a highly competent and detail-oriented Facility Supervisor to oversee the management of services and processes that support our core business operations.
	The ideal candidate will ensure that all managed facilities provide a safe, efficient, and well-maintained working environment.


Key Responsibilities


	Conduct routine inspections across all managed facilities to identify maintenance needs early.
	Implement and manage preventive maintenance programs (Plumbing, Electrical Systems, Generators, HVAC, Pest Control, Water Treatment, etc.).
	Ensure all facilities and appliances remain fully operational at all times.
	Supervise repairs and maintenance activities in line with established operational processes.
	Respond promptly to emergencies and urgent maintenance issues.
	Maintain accurate records and tracking of maintenance activities.
	Prepare and submit monthly facility management reports.
	Analyze competitor offerings and identify new business opportunities.
	Collaborate with Business Development Managers to drive growth.
	Ensure appropriate deployment of skilled Maintenance Professionals.
	Provide hands-on supervision with zero tolerance for service failure.
	Monitor compliance with company codes of conduct.
	Ensure clear communication with clients regarding service schedules.
	Conduct troubleshooting and diagnostics for maintenance requests.
	Perform routine audits on Maintenance Professionals and Suppliers.
	Submit weekly activity reports.
	Conduct regular walk-throughs for visual maintenance and security checks.
	Serve as first responder to facility emergencies.
	Ensure timely and quality-focused procurement processes.
	Service Delivery & Continuous Improvement
	Conduct operational reviews and preventive maintenance audits.
	Maintain strong customer relationships through excellent service delivery.
	Hold quarterly stakeholder meetings for operational updates.
	Propose innovative service improvements and promotional initiatives.
	Support Operations Manager in delivering client needs.


Qualifications & Experience


	Technical competency in Facilities Management, Project Management, or related fields
	Minimum of 6 years of experience in Facilities and/or Hospitality Management.
	Prior supervisory experience above entry level.
	Demonstrated ability to support sales and marketing initiatives.
	Strong understanding of operational processes and systems.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: Izabelle@5cee.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

	The Business Analyst will drive data-driven decisions across lubricant manufacturing, supply chain, and sales.

	Manufacturing Analytics:Analyze blending operations, packaging line performance, plant KPIs (OEE, cost/MT, energy usage), and identify efficiency gaps.

	5&ndash;10 years in manufacturing analytics, lubricant/FMCG/process industries preferred.
	MBA, Lean, or Six Sigma certification is a plus.


Key Competencies &amp; Attributes:


	Strong analytical thinking, attention to detail, and a data-driven mindset.
	Ability to translate data into actionable insights.
	Excellent communication, cross-functional collaboration, proactive, and accountable.


Technical Skills:


	Mandatory: Advanced Excel (Pivot Tables, Power Query, Power Pivot, automation), ERP experience, multi-source data analysis.
	Advantageous: SQL, Power BI, CRM exposure.
